com.tozny.e3db

Interface E3DBRegistrationClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RegistrationClient

    public interface E3DBRegistrationClient
    An interface for registration. Should only be used when mocking the E3DB client in unit tests.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void register(String token, String clientName, String host, okhttp3.CertificatePinner certificatePinner, ResultHandler<Config> handleResult)
      Registers a new client.
      void register(String token, String clientName, String host, ResultHandler<Config> handleResult)
      Registers a new client.

    • Method Detail

      • register

        void register(String token,
              String clientName,
              String host,
              okhttp3.CertificatePinner certificatePinner,
              ResultHandler<Config> handleResult)
        Registers a new client. This method creates a new public/private key pair for the client to use when encrypting and decrypting records.
        Parameters:
        token - Registration token obtained from the Tozny console at https://console.tozny.com.
        clientName - Name of the client; for informational purposes only.
        host - Host to register with. Should be https://api.e3db.com.
        certificatePinner - OkHttp CertificatePinner instance to restrict which certificates and authorities are trusted.
        handleResult - Handles the result of registration. The Config value can be converted to JSON, written to a secure location, and loaded later.

      • register

        void register(String token,
              String clientName,
              String host,
              ResultHandler<Config> handleResult)
        Registers a new client. This method creates a new public/private key pair for the client to use when encrypting and decrypting records.
        Parameters:
        token - Registration token obtained from the Tozny console at https://console.tozny.com.
        clientName - Name of the client; for informational purposes only.
        host - Host to register with. Should be https://api.e3db.com.
        handleResult - Handles the result of registration. The Config value can be converted to JSON, written to a secure location, and loaded later.
